intro: Tanacetum ovatifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, ovate leaves that are typically aromatic and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, forming small, clustered inflorescences. Tanacetum ovatifolium is often found in dry meadows and rocky soils, where it thrives in full sun.
